EXTRACTED VALUE: An exciting winger capable of breathtaking moments of magic, Simao will be hoping to make a major impact in Austria and Switzerland this summer.
Meireles is something of a surprise inclusion in Scolari's final 23-man squad despite making five appearances in the qualification campaign.
A perennial substitute in Portugal colours, Postiga will be hoping to seize any chances that come his way at the European Championship.
Almeida is a rising star in the Portuguese setup and looks certain to have a glittering international future in front of him.
Pepe is an exciting young defender whose emergence has put pressure on more established squad members.
A dynamic full-back who has been coveted by a number of top clubs, Miguel is somebody who never seems to be out of the action.
A small but powerful defender who has blossomed in recent years, Ribeiro will be looking to continue his progression at Euro 2008.
The only uncapped player in the Portugal squad, Patricio is an up-and-coming goalkeeper who looks set to be the long-term successor to Ricardo.
Fresh from a fantastic season with Manchester United, the mission for Ronaldo this summer is to set the international stage alight.
Carvalho has excelled in his two previous major tournaments and will once again hope to provide a solid defensive foundation.
Deco has been an integral member of the Portugal side over the last five years and is likely to be entrusted with a key role again at Euro 2008.
Hailed as one of the most exciting young prospects in European football, Nani is the latest off the supply line of Portuguese wingers.
A potential match-winner who could prove to be the long-term successor to Deco, Moutinho has been tipped for greatness since his teenage years.
Quaresma will be determined to take the European Championship by storm after being left out of the squad for the World Cup in Germany.
Gomes will take part in his fifth major tournament in Austria and Switzerland and his form in front of goal could be crucial to Portugal's hopes.
An experienced goalkeeper and twice England's scourge in penalty shoot-outs, Ricardo provides a solid foundation at the back for Portugal.
A tenacious midfielder who has earned the nickname 'Pitbull', Petit is one of the unsung heroes in Portugal's midst.
